ground_truth: Sadie sits alone watching Lost on an iPad, while Debbie rests next to Charlotte in bed and Pete is sleeping on the couch. Later, Pete sits at the counter, and Debbie and the kids are at the breakfast table. Pete drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, eating an egg sandwich and manically singing along. He walks Charlotte in, gives her a kiss, then walks back towards his car. On the way, he bumps into Joseph and his mom, thinks for a moment, not sure how to handle this, and pokes her shoulder. Meanwhile, Debbie is talking to Jodi, who is crying, when her phone buzzes. Pete and Debbie are sitting across from Vice Principal Laviani, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, in another seat. Debbie tries to hide a smile, and Pete and Debbie leave the school together, suppressing smiles. They get in separate cars and drive off. Debbie is making dinner as Pete and Charlotte sit at the table, and then she walks off. Sadie does her homework on her bed, while Charlotte brings in Sadie's electronics and puts them down in a pile beside her, walks away, and starts to slide the door closed behind her. Later, Debbie is sitting on the couch, Pete paces around the room, and they hug. The shades are closed, the room is dark, and Sadie watches the end of the last episode of Lost on a laptop as Pete enters. Debbie is speaking with Barb as they set up the kitchen for a barbecue for Pete's fortieth birthday, while Desi jumps in the pool in a small bikini and plays in the water with the kids. There's an angle on Barb and Debbie, then on Barry and Pete, followed by another angle on Barb and Debbie. Barry and Pete turn toward their wives, smile, and wave. Pete greets guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly. Pete and Ronnie are talking in the backyard, and Debbie walks over with Jason; they leave Ronnie and Jason alone. The guys spot Desi swimming in the pool as Debbie and Pete open the front door, where Oliver is standing with a nervous smile. Debbie looks at him and tries to be nice, opening the door wider, but they do not hug. He hands him a bottle. The party is in full swing, with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb getting food from the buffet as Barb and Barry try to help keep the conversation going. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets, and Claire is holding two of them while Larry carries one. Larry lifts one of the triplets up and down by the arms, simulating an elevator, then puts Jack down, and he runs off, followed by Claire. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi walk over, and he gives Desi a hug.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution

Subsequently, Pete perches at the counter, and Debbie and the youngsters are at the breakfast table. Pete drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, consuming an egg sandwich and frantically crooning along. He strolls Charlotte in, gives her a peck, then ambles back towards his automobile. On the way, he collides with Joseph and his mom, ponders for an instant, not certain how to manage this, and nudges her shoulder. Meanwhile, Debbie is conversing with Jodi, who is weeping, when her phone vibrates. Pete and Debbie are sitting across from Vice Principal Laviani, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, in another chair. Debbie endeavors to conceal a grin, and Pete and Debbie depart the school collectively, repressing grins. They enter separate automobiles and drive off. Sadie completes her homework on her bed, while Charlotte conveys Sadie's electronics and places them down in a stack beside her, ambles away, and starts to glide the door shut behind her. Subsequently, Debbie is perched on the sofa, Pete strides around the room, and they embrace. The blinds are shut, the room is dim, and Sadie observes the conclusion of the final episode of Lost on a laptop as Pete arrives. Debbie is speaking with Barb as they arrange the kitchen for a cookout for Pete's fortieth birthday, while Desi leaps in the pool in a small bikini and frolics in the water with the youngsters. There's an angle on Barb and Debbie, then on Barry and Pete, followed by another angle on Barb and Debbie. Barry and Pete pivot toward their spouses, grin, and wave. Pete greets visitors, including Graham and Grandma Molly. Pete and Ronnie are conversing in the backyard, and Debbie strolls over with Jason; they leave Ronnie and Jason unaccompanied. The guys notice Desi swimming in the pool as Debbie and Pete open the front door, where Oliver is standing with an anxious grin. Debbie glances at him and attempts to be pleasant, opening the door wider, but they do not embrace. He hands him a bottle. The celebration is in full swing, with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb acquiring food from the buffet as Barb and Barry attempt to aid in keeping the dialogue flowing. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets, and Claire is holding two of them while Larry carries one. Larry lifts one of the triplets up and down by the arms, simulating an elevator, then places Jack down, and he runs off, followed by Claire. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi stroll over, and he gives Desi an embrace.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Sadie is seated alone watching Lost on an iPad, while Debbie is resting next to Charlotte in bed and the couch is being slept on by Pete. Later, the counter is sat at by Pete, and the breakfast table is occupied by Debbie and the kids. Sadie and Charlotte are driven to school by Pete, who is eating an egg sandwich and manically singing along. Charlotte is walked in by him, given a kiss, and then he walks back towards his car. On the way, Joseph and his mom are bumped into by him, and thinking for a moment, unsure how to handle this, he pokes her shoulder. Meanwhile, Jodi is talked to by Debbie, who is crying, when her phone buzzes. Vice Principal Laviani sits across from Pete and Debbie, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, occupying another seat. A smile is tried to be hidden by Debbie, and smiles are suppressed as Pete and Debbie leave the school together. They get in separate cars and drive off. Dinner is made by Debbie as Pete and Charlotte sit at the table, and then she walks off. Homework is done by Sadie on her bed, while Sadie's electronics are brought in by Charlotte and put down in a pile beside her, walks away, and starts sliding the door closed behind her. Later, the couch is sat on by Debbie, Pete paces around the room, and they hug. The shades are closed, the room is dark, and the end of the last episode of Lost is watched by Sadie on a laptop as Pete enters. Barb is spoken to by Debbie as they set up the kitchen for a barbecue for Pete's fortieth birthday, while the pool is jumped into by Desi in a small bikini and played in with the kids. An angle is shown of Barb and Debbie, then on Barry and Pete, followed by another angle on Barb and Debbie. Their wives are turned toward by Barry and Pete, and they smile and wave. Guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly, are greeted by Pete. In the backyard, Pete and Ronnie are talking, and Debbie walks over with Jason; Ronnie and Jason are left alone by them. Desi is spotted by the guys swimming in the pool as Debbie and Pete open the front door, where Oliver stands with a nervous smile. He is looked at by Debbie, and she tries to be nice, opening the door wider, but a hug is not shared. A bottle is handed to him. The party is in full swing, with food being gotten from the buffet by Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb as Barb and Barry try to help keep the conversation going. Claire arrives with Larry and the triplets, and two of them are held by Claire while one is carried by Larry. One of the triplets is lifted up and down by Larry by the arms, simulating an elevator, then Jack is put down by him, and he runs off, followed by Claire. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi walk over, and Desi is given a hug by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Sadie watches *Lost* on an iPad while Debbie rests next to Charlotte in bed and Pete sleeps on the couch. Later, Pete sits at the counter as Debbie and the kids are at breakfast. He drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, eating an egg sandwich and singing. He walks Charlotte in, kisses her, and heads back to the car, bumping into Joseph and his mom, unsure how to react, and pokes her shoulder. Debbie talks to Jodi, who is crying when her phone buzzes. Pete and Debbie are with Vice Principal Laviani, and Joseph's mom, Catherine. Debbie hides a smile, and they leave school together, suppressing grins. They drive off separately. Debbie makes dinner as Pete and Charlotte sit at the table, and then she leaves. Sadie does homework on her bed, Charlotte brings Sadie's electronics, places them beside her, and walks away, sliding the door closed. Later, Debbie is on the couch, Pete paces, and they hug. The room is dark; Sadie finishes *Lost* on a laptop as Pete enters. Debbie talks with Barb while setting up a barbecue for Pete's fortieth birthday. Desi plays in the pool with the kids. Angles show Barb and Debbie, then Barry and Pete, who turn to their wives, smiling. Pete greets guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly. Pete and Ronnie chat, Debbie arrives with Jason, and they leave Ronnie and Jason alone. The guys see Desi in the pool as Debbie and Pete open the door to Oliver, who nervously smiles, hands a bottle, but they don't hug. The party is lively with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb at the buffet, trying to keep the conversation going. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets, Claire holding two while Larry carries one. He lifts a triplet like an elevator, puts him down, and Jack runs off with Claire. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi approach, and Larry hugs Desi.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Sadie watches Lost on an iPad alone, while Debbie rests with Charlotte, and Pete sleeps on the couch. Later, Pete, eating and singing, drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, kisses Charlotte, and bumps into Joseph's mom before retreating. Debbie chats with Jodi, whose crying is interrupted by her phone. At school, Pete and Debbie meet Vice Principal Laviani and Joseph's mom, Catherine, and leave hiding smiles. They drive off separately. Debbie cooks dinner as Pete and Charlotte sit, while Sadie does homework, and Charlotte places Sadie's electronics beside her. Later, Debbie and Pete hug in a dark room as Sadie finishes Lost. Debbie prepares for Pete's fortieth birthday barbecue with Barb as Desi plays in the pool. Barb, Debbie, Barry, and Pete exchange glances and wave. Pete greets guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly. Debbie introduces Jason to Pete, leaving Ronnie and Jason alone. They spot Desi in the pool as Oliver arrives nervously and hands a bottle to Pete. The party bustles as Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barb, and Barry get food. Larry arrives with Claire and triplets. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi join Larry, who hugs Desi.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Sadie is sitting all by herself, watching the series Lost on an iPad, while Debbie is comfortably resting next to Charlotte in bed. Meanwhile, Pete is soundly sleeping on the couch. Later on, Pete finds himself seated at the kitchen counter, while Debbie and the kids are gathering around the breakfast table. Pete takes on the responsibility of driving Sadie and Charlotte to their school, all the while enjoying an egg sandwich and energetically singing along to a tune. Upon their arrival, he takes Charlotte inside, gives her a gentle kiss, and then starts to make his way back to his car. On his way, he unexpectedly bumps into Joseph and his mother. He pauses for a brief moment, uncertain of how to proceed, and lightly pokes her shoulder. At the same time, Debbie is engaged in a conversation with Jodi, who is visibly upset and crying, when her phone suddenly buzzes. The scene shifts to Pete and Debbie sitting across from Vice Principal Laviani at the school, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, also present in another seat. Debbie makes an effort to conceal a smile, and eventually, both Pete and Debbie leave the school building together, both trying to suppress their smiles. They proceed to get into separate cars and drive away. 

As the day unfolds, Debbie is seen preparing dinner in the kitchen while Pete and Charlotte are seated at the dining table, and then she leaves the room. Sadie is working on her homework on her bed, while Charlotte walks in, carrying Sadie's electronics, and places them down in a neat pile beside her. She then walks away, sliding the door closed behind her. Later on, Debbie can be seen sitting on the couch, while Pete paces restlessly around the room. Eventually, they come together for a hug. With the shades drawn, the room is enveloped in darkness as Sadie watches the ending of the last episode of Lost on a laptop when Pete enters the scene. In another part of the story, Debbie is engaged in a conversation with Barb, and together, they are preparing the kitchen for a barbecue in celebration of Pete's fortieth birthday. Meanwhile, Desi energetically jumps into the pool clad in a small bikini and playfully interacts with the kids in the water. Various camera angles capture moments with Barb and Debbie, followed by Barry and Pete, and back to Barb and Debbie again. Barry and Pete then turn toward their wives, smiling warmly and waving. Pete continues to greet arriving guests, among them are Graham and Grandma Molly. In the backyard, Pete and Ronnie are engaged in conversation when Debbie approaches with Jason; soon after, she leaves Ronnie and Jason alone together. The men take notice of Desi as she swims in the pool while Debbie and Pete open the front door, revealing Oliver standing there with a nervous smile on his face. Debbie looks at him with an attempt to be kind, opening the door wider, but they do not embrace. He hands over a bottle. The party is in full swing now, with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb helping themselves to food from the buffet table and Barb and Barry making efforts to keep the conversation lively. Larry makes his entrance with Claire and their triplets, with Claire holding two of the little ones while Larry carries the other. Larry plays a game, lifting one of the triplets up and down by the arms in a motion simulating an elevator, then gently sets Jack down, prompting him to run off, followed closely by Claire. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi then walk over to Larry, and he gives Desi an affectionate hug.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Sadie finds herself quietly seated all by her lonesome, intently watching the television series Lost on her handy iPad, while, in the cozy comfort of a nearby bed, Debbie is nestled snugly beside Charlotte. Meanwhile, in a separate part of the house, Pete is peacefully asleep, sprawled out on the couch. As time progresses, Pete relocates to the kitchen, taking a seat at the counter, while Debbie, accompanied by the kids, gathers around the breakfast table. Pete assumes the role of chauffeur, taking it upon himself to drive Sadie and Charlotte to their school. As they embark on this morning journey, he relishes an egg sandwich and exuberantly sings along to a lively tune. Upon reaching their destination, he escorts Charlotte inside, offering her a tender kiss before beginning his return to the car. Along the way, he unexpectedly encounters Joseph and his mother, which causes him to hesitate momentarily, uncertain about what to do, before he gently taps her shoulder. Simultaneously, Debbie is deep in conversation with a visibly upset and tearful Jodi when her phone unexpectedly buzzes. 

The scene then transitions to a meeting at the school, where Pete and Debbie are seated across from Vice Principal Laviani. Joseph's mother, Catherine, is also in attendance, occupying another seat in the room. During the meeting, Debbie tries to stifle a smile, and eventually, Pete and Debbie exit the school together, both endeavoring to keep their smiles from breaking through. They head to their respective vehicles and drive away. 

As the day continues to unfold, Debbie is observed preparing dinner in the kitchen, while Pete and Charlotte sit patiently at the dining table. Debbie then leaves the room. In another scene, Sadie is diligently working on her homework in her bedroom, sitting on her bed. Charlotte enters, carrying Sadie's various electronic devices, and carefully places them in a tidy pile next to her sister. Afterward, Charlotte exits the room, sliding the door shut behind her. In a later moment, Debbie finds herself seated on the couch, as Pete paces restively about the room. Eventually, the two come together for an affectionate hug. With the shades drawn, the room is shrouded in darkness while Sadie watches the climactic ending of the final episode of Lost on her laptop. At that moment, Pete makes his entrance. 

In a different storyline segment, Debbie engages in a conversation with Barb, and together they begin preparing the kitchen for a barbecue to celebrate Pete's monumental fortieth birthday. In the backyard, Desi energetically leaps into the pool wearing a small bikini, playfully interacting with the children splashing about in the water. Various camera angles capture intimate moments shared by Barb and Debbie, followed by glimpses of Barry with Pete, and then returning to Barb and Debbie once more. Barry and Pete then turn their attention to their wives, offering warm smiles and friendly waves. Pete continues to welcome arriving guests, among them Graham and Grandma Molly. 

As the lively backyard scene unfolds, Pete and Ronnie engage in a conversation when Debbie approaches alongside Jason. She soon departs, leaving Jason and Ronnie to their own devices. The men notice Desi swimming in the pool, while Debbie and Pete open the front door to reveal Oliver standing there with a somewhat nervous smile. Debbie regards him with friendly intent, opening the door wider, but there is no embrace. Instead, he hands over a bottle. The party is now in full swing, with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb indulging in food from the buffet table, while Barb and Barry make concerted efforts to maintain a lively conversation. Larry arrives with Claire and their triplets, Claire carrying two little ones while Larry handles the third. Larry entertains the children by lifting one of the triplets up and down in a playful elevator motion before gently setting Jack down, prompting him to run off, with Claire following closely behind. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi approach Larry, and he greets Desi with a warm, affectionate hug.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Sadie sits by herself in a quiet space, intently watching an episode of Lost on her iPad, while Debbie is comfortably resting next to Charlotte in bed, and Pete is sprawled out on the couch, deep in sleep. As time progresses, Pete finds himself sitting at the counter, while Debbie, along with the kids, takes their places around the breakfast table, creating a morning routine. The day advances with Pete heading out to drive Sadie and Charlotte to school; he multitasks by eating an egg sandwich and energetically singing along to the car music. Upon arriving at the school, he gently escorts Charlotte inside, plants a tender kiss on her cheek, and turns back towards his car. On his way, he unexpectedly encounters Joseph and his mom, pausing for a moment of contemplation, unsure about his next move, before lightly poking her shoulder to greet her. Concurrently, Debbie is engulfed in a conversation with Jodi, who is visibly upset and crying, when suddenly her phone vibrates, drawing her attention. Shortly after, Pete and Debbie find themselves seated across from Vice Principal Laviani in an office, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, occupying another chair. In response to the situation, Debbie subtly attempts to suppress a smile, and as the meeting concludes, Pete and Debbie exit the school together, both stifling amused smiles. They get into separate vehicles as they prepare to leave, each driving off in their own direction. The scene shifts to Debbie, who is in the midst of preparing dinner, while Pete and Charlotte are seated at the dining table; afterward, she leaves the room. Meanwhile, Sadie is diligently working on her homework on her bed when Charlotte enters, carrying Sadie's electronics, which she arranges in a pile beside her before walking away and slowly sliding the door closed behind her. Later in the evening, Debbie finds herself nestled on the couch as Pete moves restlessly around the room, and eventually, they share a warm embrace. In the darkness of the room, with shades drawn, Sadie intently watches the final episode of Lost on her laptop as Pete makes an entrance. As the narrative continues, Debbie engages in a conversation with Barb as they both busily set up the kitchen for a barbecue in celebration of Pete's fortieth birthday, while Desi, clad in a small bikini, energetically leaps into the pool and frolics in the water with the children. The camera shifts angles, first focusing on Barb and Debbie, then transitioning to Barry and Pete, followed once again by the scene featuring Barb and Debbie. Barry and Pete share a light-hearted moment, turning towards their wives, smiling, and waving. As the party livens up, Pete warmly greets guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly. In the backyard, Pete and Ronnie engage in conversation while Debbie approaches with Jason, then they choose to leave Ronnie and Jason to their own devices. The two men casually observe Desi swimming in the pool, at which point Debbie and Pete open the front door to reveal Oliver standing there with a nervous smile. Debbie meets his gaze with an attempt at friendliness, widening the door to invite him in, although the interaction does not culminate in a hug. Oliver extends a bottle to him as a gesture. With the party in full swing, Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb enthusiastically help themselves to food from the buffet, with Barb and Barry making efforts to keep the conversation flowing smoothly. As the celebrations continue, Larry arrives accompanied by Claire and their triplets, with Claire holding two of them while Larry manages the third. Larry amusingly lifts one of the triplets up and down by the arms, mimicking an elevator ride before setting Jack down, who delightedly scampers off, with Claire following behind. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi approach, and in a moment of affection, he wraps Desi in a hug.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Sadie sits alone watching Lost on an iPad while Debbie rests beside Charlotte in bed and Pete sleeps on the couch. Later, Pete sits at the counter while Debbie and the kids have breakfast. Pete drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, eating an egg sandwich and singing along energetically. After walking Charlotte in and kissing her goodbye, Pete returns to his car and bumps into Joseph and his mom, hesitating before poking her shoulder. Meanwhile, Debbie talks to a crying Jodi when her phone buzzes. Pete and Debbie are seated with Vice Principal Laviani, joined by Joseph's mother, Catherine. Debbie suppresses a smile, and the couple leaves the school, barely containing their amusement. They drive off in separate cars. While Debbie makes dinner, Pete and Charlotte sit at the table until Debbie steps away. Sadie does homework on her bed as Charlotte returns Sadie's electronics, places them beside her, and slides the door closed. Later, Debbie and Pete share a hug in a dim, shaded room while Sadie watches Lost's finale on her laptop as Pete enters. Debbie and Barb prepare the kitchen for Pete's fortieth birthday barbecue while Desi swims with the kids. The camera shifts between Barb and Debbie, Barry and Pete, and back to the women. Barry and Pete smile and wave at their wives. Pete greets guests, including Graham and Grandma Molly, then talks with Ronnie in the backyard as Debbie and Jason join but soon depart, leaving Ronnie and Jason alone. The guys notice Desi swimming while Debbie and Pete open the front door for Oliver, who nervously smiles as Debbie welcomes him with a wider door opening but no hug. The party bustles with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb getting food as Barb and Barry maintain lively conversation. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets, lifting one like an elevator before setting him down, prompting Jack to run off with Claire following. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi approach, and Larry gives Desi a hug.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Sadie sits alone watching "Lost," a popular TV series from the mid-2000s known for its mysterious and complex storyline, on an iPad, a widely used tablet device, while Debbie rests next to Charlotte in bed and Pete is sleeping on the couch, where the family often relaxes after a long day. Later, Pete sits at the counter, and Debbie and the kids are at the breakfast table, a typical family gathering spot for morning meals. Pete drives Sadie and Charlotte to school, a local elementary institution with a reputation for strong academics, eating an egg sandwich and manically singing along to his favorite tunes from the radio. He walks Charlotte in, gives her a kiss, then walks back towards his car. On the way, he bumps into Joseph and his mom, residents of the same neighborhood, thinks for a moment, not sure how to handle this, and pokes her shoulder to get her attention. Meanwhile, Debbie is talking to Jodi, who is crying, when her phone buzzes with a message. Pete and Debbie are sitting across from Vice Principal Laviani, a seasoned educator with a strong presence, with Joseph's mother, Catherine, in another seat. Debbie tries to hide a smile, and Pete and Debbie leave the school together, suppressing smiles that suggest relief or amusement. They get in separate cars and drive off. Debbie is making dinner, preparing a classic family recipe, as Pete and Charlotte sit at the table, and then she walks off to check on something in the oven. Sadie does her homework on her bed, working through her favorite subject, while Charlotte brings in Sadie's electronics, essential tools for schoolwork, and puts them down in a pile beside her, walks away, and starts to slide the door closed behind her. Later, Debbie is sitting on the couch, Pete paces around the room, likely processing the day's events, and they hug. The shades are closed, the room is dark, and Sadie watches the end of the last episode of "Lost" on a laptop as Pete enters. Debbie is speaking with Barb as they set up the kitchen for a barbecue for Pete's fortieth birthday, a milestone celebrated with friends and family, while Desi jumps in the pool in a small bikini and plays in the water with the kids, who enjoy the summer day. There's an angle on Barb and Debbie, then on Barry and Pete, followed by another angle on Barb and Debbie, capturing the joyful dynamics of the gathering. Barry and Pete turn toward their wives, smile, and wave, acknowledging their support. Pete greets guests, including Graham, his old college roommate, and Grandma Molly, adored by the family for her wisdom and stories. Pete and Ronnie are talking in the backyard, and Debbie walks over with Jason; they leave Ronnie and Jason alone to catch up. The guys spot Desi swimming in the pool as Debbie and Pete open the front door, where Oliver, a distant cousin who hasn't been seen in years, is standing with a nervous smile. Debbie looks at him and tries to be nice, opening the door wider, but they do not hug, suggesting a formality between them. He hands him a bottle of wine, a customary gift for such occasions. The party is in full swing, with Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb getting food from the buffet, a spread of barbecue dishes and side salads, as Barb and Barry try to help keep the conversation going, ensuring everyone's engaged. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets, known for their boundless energy, and Claire is holding two of them while Larry carries one. Larry lifts one of the triplets up and down by the arms, simulating an elevator, then puts Jack down, and he runs off, followed by Claire, who keeps a watchful eye. Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi walk over, and he gives Desi a hug, showing his affection for the close family friend.

Debbie tries to hide a smile and Pete and Debbie leave the school together suppressing smiles. They get in separate cars and drive off. Debbie is making dinner as Pete and Charlotte sit at the table and then she walks off. Sadie does her homework on her bed while Charlotte brings in Sadie's electronics and puts them down in a pile beside her walks away and starts to slide the door closed behind her. Later Debbie is sitting on the couch. Pete paces around the room and they hug. The shades are closed. the room is dark and Sadie watches the end of the last episode of Lost on a laptop as Pete enters Debbie is speaking with Barb as they set up the kitchen for a barbecue for Pete's fortieth birthday while Desi jumps in the pool in a small bikini and plays in the water with the kids. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. There is an angle on Barb and Debbie then on Barry and Pete followed by another angle on Barb and Debbie. Barry and Pete turn toward their wives smile and wave. Pete greets guests including Graham and Grandma Molly. Pete and Ronnie are talking in the backyard and Debbie walks over with Jason. they leave Ronnie and Jason alone. The guys spot Desi swimming in the pool. as Debbie and Pete open the front door where Oliver is standing with a nervous smile. Debbie looks at him and tries to be nice opening the door wider but they do not hug. He hands him a bottle. The party is in full swing with Pete Debbie Oliver Barry and Barb getting food from the buffet as Barb and Barry try to help keep the conversation going. Larry arrives with Claire and the triplets and Claire is holding two of them while Larry carries one. Larry lifts one of the triplets up and down by the arms simulating an elevator. then puts Jack down and he runs off followed by Claire. Sadie. Charlotte and Desi walk over and he gives Desi a hug.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Ethan reclines alone observing The Office on a smartphone, while Linda lounges beside Bridget on the hammock and Max snoozes on the hammock. Later, Max perches at the piano, and Linda and the puppies are at the picnic blanket. Max pedals Ethan and Bridget to the zoo, gnawing a donut and frantically humming along. He escorts Bridget inside, gives her a high five, then strolls back towards his scooter. On the path, he collides with Michael and his aunt, ponders briefly, uncertain how to proceed, and tickles her elbow. Meanwhile, Linda is conversing with Kim, who is laughing, when her tablet rings. Max and Linda are lounging in front of Security Officer Ramirez, with Michael's aunt, Stephanie, in a separate hammock. Linda attempts to conceal a grin, and Max and Linda exit the zoo together, stifling grins. They hop on different bicycles and cycle off. Linda is crafting a salad as Max and Bridget perch at the countertop, and then she strides off. Ethan tackles his puzzles on his hammock, while Bridget carries in Ethan's books and places them down in a heap beside him, strides away, and begins to swing the gate closed behind her. Later, Linda is reclining on the hammock, Max wanders around the space, and they shake hands. The blinds are shut, the space is dim, and Ethan observes the finale of The Office on a television as Max enters. Linda is chatting with Dorothy as they prepare the basement for a cookout for Max's fiftieth anniversary, while Nellie leaps into the fountain in a tiny sundress and splashes in the liquid with the puppies. There's a view of Dorothy and Linda, then on George and Max, followed by another view of Dorothy and Linda. George and Max glance at their spouses, grin, and salute. Max welcomes visitors, including Thomas and Aunt Agnes. Max and Ralphie are conversing in the barn, and Linda strolls over with Edward; they leave Ralphie and Edward by themselves. The gentlemen observe Nellie soaking in the pond as Linda and Max unlock the side gate, where Brian is standing with an anxious grin. Linda glances at him and attempts to be cordial, widening the gate, but they do not shake hands. He hands him a candle. The celebration is in full swing, with Max, Linda, Brian, George, and Dorothy gathering snacks from the table as Dorothy and George attempt to aid in maintaining the interaction. Gary arrives with Annie and the kittens, and Annie is cradling two of them while Gary hauls one. Gary lifts one of the kittens up and down by the paws, emulating a see-saw, then places James down, and he dashes off, pursued by Annie. Ethan, Bridget, and Nellie meander over, and he gives Nellie a handshake.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Sadie watches Lost on an iPad, while Debbie, Charlotte, and Pete are resting. Pete takes Sadie and Charlotte to school, singing and eating a sandwich. After dropping off Charlotte, he awkwardly encounters Joseph and his mom. Debbie talks to Jodi, who's crying, and gets a call. Later, Pete and Debbie meet with Vice Principal Laviani and Joseph's mother, Catherine, at school. They leave, hiding smiles, and drive off separately. As Debbie makes dinner, Pete and Charlotte sit at the table, and Sadie does homework. Debbie and Pete hug in the darkened room as Sadie finishes Lost. For Pete's fortieth birthday barbecue, Debbie and Barb set up the kitchen while Desi swims with the kids. Guests include Graham, Grandma Molly, Oliver, Barry, Barb, and Larry with Claire and their triplets. At the party, Pete, Debbie, Oliver, Barry, and Barb gather food as they keep conversations going. Larry plays with the triplets, and Sadie, Charlotte, and Desi join in as Desi gets a hug.
